trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataError"></xref> event.
Handling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataError> event lets you handle exceptions thrown by code outside your control (for example, by an external data source).
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorEventArgs.Context%2A> property to determine the state of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> at the time of the exception.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorEventArgs.Exception%2A> property to retrieve the exception data.
If you want to handle the exception by additional event handlers, set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorEventArgs.ThrowException%2A> property to `true`.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCancelEventArgs.ColumnIndex%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCancelEventArgs.RowIndex%2A> properties normally indicate the cell in which the data error occurred.
When the error occurs in an external data source, however, the data source may not provide the column in which the error occurred.
In this case, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellCancelEventArgs.ColumnIndex%2A> property typically indicates the column of the current cell at the time of the error.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorEventArgs"></xref> class.
The exception that occurred.
The column index of the cell that raised the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataError"></xref>.
The row index of the cell that raised the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataError"></xref>.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorContexts"></xref> values indicating the context in which the error occurred.
Gets details about the state of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> when the error occurred.

Members of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorContexts> enumeration may be combined using the bitwise `OR` operator to represent the state of a data-bound <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> when a data error occurred.

For example, if a user enters an invalid cell value (such as entering a name in a cell that requires a date) and then selects a different cell, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> will try to commit the invalid cell value.

When the commit fails, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> will raise a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataError> event whose Context property will have a value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorContexts> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorContexts>.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorContexts"></xref> values that specifies the context in which the error occurred.
Gets the exception that represents the error.

To handle the exception by more than one <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorEventHandler>, throw the exception again at the end of a handler by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorEventArgs.ThrowException%2A> property to `true`.
An <xref:System.Exception> that represents the error.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to throw the exception after the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorEventHandler"></xref> delegate is finished with it.

Set this property to `false` if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorEventHandler> has dealt with the exception represented by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorEventArgs.Exception%2A> property, and you do not want to propagate the exception to another <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorEventHandler> that may handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataError> event.
For debugging purposes, it can be useful to propagate the exception and inspect the stack trace for information regarding the context of the error.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the exception should be thrown; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

When setting this property to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorEventArgs.Exception*> property value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
